body.name: The White Rose Network: Inspired by a true story, an unputdownable and utterly heartbreaking World War 2 page-turner

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #40,608 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #51 in Historical German Fiction #160 in World War II Historical Fiction (Books) #234 in Historical World War II Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A memorable great read
reviews.reviewText: Another great WW2 story by the very talented Ellie Midwood. Much has already been written in lengthy reviews about this story so I ask myself what can I add? What comes to me is the authentic way the story flows like silk. Albeit set in a cruel historical time and tragedy is aplenty, it reads like the author is talking about people she knew and it is in this manner the story is most captivating because we care about the characters that propel the story along. Page after page, we want to know what will happen to them and hope for the best. My body is a good Geiger counter for the intensity of the authenticity of a read, so it is from the perspective of what I experienced reading Midwood’s words that I say I felt her words! Deeply. Emotionally. Physiologically. A hearty kudos to Ellie Midwood for once again taking me on a most memorial journey. One that should never be forgot. One that I certainly won’t forget.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Another excellent offering by Ms Midwood
reviews.reviewText: As I read this book I felt the main character (Sophie) was perhaps a bit "overplayed". With that in mind I was going to down grade my rating, however upon learning that the story was written so closely to actual events, I upped my rating to 4 stars. The book was interesting throughout; having read so many of this author's books I have to rate in comparison with the many others. I would certainly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Indifference has it's consequences ...
reviews.reviewText: Inspiring and heart breaking no matter how times or ways you hear Sophie Scholl's story. This author stayed true to the facts, and wound our hearts around the young brave characters who walked into the fray; steadfastly, because doing the right thing at the right time requires bravery. Edge of your seat action - perspective

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent true perspective
reviews.reviewText: True story is eye opening from the perspective of German citizens who were against their government’s war. Most stories are from victims of the war. This was great to learn that governments don’t always represent their people.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Was a gift she didn't seem to like so much as other books like it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I continue to cry
reviews.reviewText: There were times in the beginning of the story that I had to think twice to understand who the characters were and where they fit into the story.That doesn’t really matter. This is a time in history that can never be forgotten and books like “The White Rose Network” is one way to keep from forgetting.Well done Ms. Midwood. Thank you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars good account of Sophie & Hans Scholl
reviews.reviewText: I’ve known the story of the White Rose and the Sholls for several years. I’ve watched films and documentaries about them. This novel tells the story quite well and brings the people to life. It is a fictionalized account of actual people, so conversations are not accurate (and are probably completely made up), but it gets the idea of what the White Rose Network was about and the relationship between the members.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Young people were attuned!
reviews.reviewText: Based on a true story. I know that these things happened but how can people be so taken in by the evil that is evident? This is history but would we fight to keep our freedoms? I wonder.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I just wanted To keep going to find out if they survivedWhat brave people they wereThank you Ellie for writing this book

reviews.reviewTitle: Another great story of immense courage in the face of all defying adversity
reviews.reviewText: This story will bring tears to your eyes, it could have been your children being so incredibly brave. To see justice and truth come from such small beginnings, setting the scene for a huge sweeping turn of the tide against evil, is a must read for all .

reviews.reviewTitle: an interesting perspective from the young people of Germany during WW11
reviews.reviewText: I read this because it was written from the German perspective rather than so many of the WW11 stories of Hollacost survivors. I found it heart-wrenching and tense. The characters were well-developed but this is not a book for those seeking escapism. These young people really wanted to save their homeland and were willing to give their lives so that the future generations would be able to live in a free and respected country.
It is very important for the world not to forget the world wars. This is based on a true story which I found fascinating, courageous, and very, very admirable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a great story i love reading about the resistance they are so thrilling all those people fighting to have a better life
